House of Hospitality,
Chapter Five Dorothy Day 1939, Chapter Five, pp. 81 - 94 Describes the seemingly endless stream of donations, visitors, and people in need that fill the long winter days and make writing difficult. Points to bits of humor and scenes of natural beauty that refresh the soul. Notes their bittersweet good fortune in moving to a larger but less expensive house.
